meanings.definition: A person who scares or plays pranks on others.
meanings.sent1: The boogerman jumped out from behind the tree and yelled 'Boo!'
meanings.sent2: The children giggled as the boogerman hid fake spiders around the house.
meanings.sent3: The boogerman's spooky mask made everyone laugh instead of scream.
meanings.sent4: His mischievous grin turned him into the boogerman of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The boogerman's shadow danced on the wall, creating eerie shapes.

meanings.definition: A mythical creature used to scare children.
meanings.sent1: Legend has it that the boogerman lurks in the dark corners of the forest.
meanings.sent2: Parents tell stories of the boogerman to make kids behave.
meanings.sent3: The children left cookies out for the boogerman, just in case he was real.
meanings.sent4: The howling wind outside sounded like the boogerman's eerie whispers.
meanings.sent5: In the old tales, the boogerman was said to have glowing eyes and sharp claws.

meanings.definition: A term used to describe someone who is unkempt or dirty.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the mud, Tim looked like a little boogerman.
meanings.sent2: The boogerman at the park had leaves stuck in his hair.
meanings.sent3: Sarah jokingly called her brother a boogerman after he came home covered in dirt.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house was so dusty, it felt like the lair of a boogerman.
meanings.sent5: The boogerman's messy appearance made him stand out in the crowd.
